title: Criticism of the Western Civilization - C.55 (Alcoholism,Drugs5)
description:
Criticism of the Western Civilization - Collection 55 (Alcoholism, Drug Abuse 5):

We have 35 titles here:

-  Bennett & Holloway - Understanding Drugs, Alcohol and Crime (2005)

-  Boyle et al (Eds.) - Alcohol; Science, Policy, and Public Health (2013)

-  Dalrymple - Romancing Opiates; Pharmacological Lies and the Addiction Bureaucracy (2006)

-  Dodes - The Heart of Addiction; a New Approach to Understanding and Managing Alcoholism and Other Addictive Behaviors (2002)

-  Foxcroft - The Making of Addiction; the Use and Abuse of Opium in 19th-Century Britain (2007)

-  Freimuth - Addicted; Recognizing Destructive Behavior Before It's Too Late (2008)

-  Galanter & Kaskutas (Eds.) - Recent Development in Alcoholism, Vol. 18; Research on Alcoholics Anonymous and Spirituality in Addiction Recovery (2008)

-  Goldberg & Latimer - Flowers in the Blood; the Story of Opium (2014)

-  Gray - Why Our Drug Laws Have Failed and What We Can Do about It; a Judicial Indictment of the War on Drugs, 2e (2012)

-  Heyman - Addiction; a Disorder of Choice (2009)

-  Hitchens - The War We Never Fought; the British Establishment's Surrender to Drugs (2012)

-  Johnston - Drink; the Intimate Relationship between Women and Alcohol (2013)

-  Kaminer & Bukstein (Eds.) - Adolescent Substance Abuse; Psychiatric Comorbidity and High-Risk Behaviors (2008)

-  Kranzler & Korsmeyer - Encyclopedia of Drugs, Alcohol & Addictive Behavior, 3e (2009)

-  Kuhar - The Addicted Brain; Why We Abuse Drugs, Alcohol, and Nicotine (2012)

-  Kuhn et al - Buzzed; the Straight Facts About the Most Used and Abused Drugs from Alcohol to Ecstasy (2014)

-  Manning - Drugs and Popular Culture in the Age of New Media (2014)

-  Miller (Ed.) - Principles of Addiction; Comprehensive Addictive Behaviors and Disorders (2013)

-  Osborn - Rum Maniacs; Alcoholic Insanity in the Early American Republic (2014)

-  Paoli et al - The World Heroin Market; Can Supply Be Cut (2009)

-  Phillips - Alcohol; a History (2014)

-  Power - Drugs Unlimited; the Web Revolution That's Changing How the World Gets High (2013)

-  Riley et al (Eds.) - Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder; Management and Policy Perspectives of FASD (2011)

-  Shannon (Ed.) - Alcoholism Sourcebook, 3e (2010)

-  Sheff - Clean; Overcoming Addiction and Ending America's Greatest Tragedy (2013)

-  Sixx & Gittins - The Heroin Diaries; a Year in the Life of a Shattered Rock Star (2007)

-  Starling - The Action of Alcohol on Man (1923)

-  Stewart & Conrod (Eds.) - Anxiety and Substance Use Disorders; the Vicious Cycle of Comorbidity (2008)

-  Stromberg & Merrill - Second Chances; Top Executives Share Their Stories of Addiction and Recovery (2009)

-  Sullivan - Thirty Rooms to Hide In; Insanity, Addiction, and Rock 'n' Roll in the Shadow of the Mayo Clinic (2011)

-  Urschel - Healing the Addicted Brain; the Revolutionary, Science-Based Alcoholism and Addiction Recovery Program (2009)

-  Vasiliou et al (Eds.) - Biological Basis of Alcohol-Induced Cancer (2015)

-  Velez-Mitchell & Mohr - Addict Nation; an Intervention for America (2011)

-  Watson & Myers (Eds.) - Alcohol and Heart Disease (2002)

-  Weiland - Fall to Pieces; a Memoir of Drugs, Rock 'n' Roll, and Mental Illness (2009)
